title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

11:53 <alex-xwiki> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <alex-xwiki> Hi guys  
11:56 <alex-xwiki> Today at 12:30 PM Paris time I'm going to restart the machine on which build agents 3, 4, 5 and 6  are running.  
11:56 <alex-xwiki> Reason of the restart: kernel update.  
11:56 <alex-xwiki> Estimated downtime: 15 minutes  
12:10 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <mflorea> has quit  
12:41 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
12:45 <silviar> has left #xwiki  
13:05 <+sburjan> hello tmortagne . Could you close http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6405 ? It has been fixed since a long time  
13:26 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <+tmortagne> sburjan: do you know the fix for ?  
14:12 <+sburjan> tmortagne: it's already fixed. the issue is from 2009. it no longer reproduces  
14:17 <+sburjan> but no, I don't know which commit fixed it  
14:18 <+sburjan> it was fixed before I joined the community afair  
14:32 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <silviar> has quit  
14:47 <+tmortagne> sburjan: lets close it as cannot reproduce then  
14:47 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <+sburjan> tmortagne: ok  
14:48 <+tmortagne> sburjan: could you put a comment explaining that it's already fixed since a long time  
14:48 <+tmortagne> ?  
14:48 <+sburjan> yepp  
14:48 <+sburjan> ofc  
14:48 <+tmortagne> thanks  
14:51 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I can't close it. Only a committer can. It seems I have no rights  
14:52 <+sburjan> thanks  
15:41 <silviar> has quit  
16:07 <lucaa> has quit  
16:08 <fmancinelli> has quit  
16:21 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <+lucaa> hi team  
16:55 <+lucaa> I just noticed that when you ask for a scripting service that doesn't exist, from a scripting language such as velocity, you get an exception  
16:55 <+lucaa> e.g. in a page, put  
16:55 <+lucaa> $services.nonexistingservice  
16:56 <+lucaa> I would really prefer to get a null in velocity, since there is no exception catching mechanism  
16:56 <+lucaa> is this by design?  
16:56 <+lucaa> (I tested on myxwiki, which is 3.2)  
16:56 <+lucaa> (well all that in a velocity script in the page, of course)

23:49 <tekzilla> hey, why would xwiki fail to replace the vars in the confirmation mail  
23:56 <@cjdelisl1> I can't think of a reason based on that info, I do know that #set directives inside of confirmation mail templates don't work.
